description: Index and brief description of topics in the Library.
title: INDEX TO TOPICS

description: Moses' older brother, the first high priest. According to the genealogical lists he was third in descent from Levi (Ex. 6:16-20; 1 Ch. 6:1-3).
title: Aaron

description: In Matthew 24:15-20, our Lord Himself spoke of the "abomination of desolation".
title: Abomination of Desolation

description: "I will bless those who bless you, and whoever curses you I will curse; and all peoples on earth will be blessed through you." This is the beginning of the covenant with Abram.
title: Abrahamic Covenant

description: David's third son by Maacah daughter of Talmai king of Geshur (a small country between Hermon and Bashan).
title: Absalom

description: chronology, and some of the political background of the Acts of the Apostles.
title: Acts, Historical Background

description: an introduction to the study of the Acts of the Apostles.
title: Acts, Introduction

description: outline of the book of Acts.
title: Acts, Outline

description: a survey of the Acts of the Apostles.
title: Acts, Survey

description: It is fitting that we start with Adam, because Adam was the first head of the human race. By looking at Adam's life we can discover the beginnings of our problems... and solutions.
title: Adam

description: From Eph. 1:5, Gal. 4:5, etc., notes on the believer's spiritual adoption.
title: Adoption

description: Christ, the Son, and the Holy Spirit are our advocates with the Father, protecting us against the lies of Satan.
title: Advocacy

description: The brotherly common meals of the early Church.
title: The Agape Feast

description: Israelites learned farming during 400 years in Egypt. Description of farming practices and OT laws regulating them.
title: Agriculture in Palestine

description: City in Egypt founded by Alexander the Great. Birthplace of Apollos. Work site for the Septuagint version of the Old Testament.
title: Alexandria

description: Amalek was the son of Eliphaz and grandson of Esau (Gen. 36:12, 16), and as a collective noun, the Amelekites, were his descendants.
title: Amalekites

description: Now then, we are ambassadors for Christ.
title: Ambassadorship

description: The name Amorite is used in the OT to denote (1) the inhabitants of Palestine generally, (2) the population of the hills as opposed to the plain, and (3) a specific people under a king of their own.
title: Amorites

description: A prophet of the 8th cent B.C., and the third book of the Minor Prophets.
title: Amos

description: by Xenophon, The March of the Ten Thousand. The most famous work of the Greek professional soldier and writer Xenophon. The journey it narrates is his best known accomplishment and "one of the great adventures in human history."
title: Anabasis

description: a categorial study of the Doctrine of Angels.
title: Angels

description: What the Bible says about anger, ours and God's. How to deal with sinful anger.
title: Anger

description: In the Church Age, antichrist refers to any believer who resides and functions in the world system of Satan.
title: Antichrist

description: Antinomianism is the view that Christians are exempt from the demands of the moral law by reason of their reliance upon divine grace alone for salvation.
title: Antinomianism

description: where followers of Christ were first called Christians, is located some three hundred miles north of Jerusalem, on the west bank of the Orontes River.
title: Antioch

description: The word Apocrypha means "hidden", or "secret". The term "Apocrypha" is usually applied to a collection of books, from eleven to sixteen in number, which appeared during the interim between the Old and New Testaments. These books have come down to us in more or less close connection with the canonical books of the Bible.
title: Apocrypha and non-Canonical WritingsApocrypha

description: a short account of what the Bible has to say about this friend of the apostle Paul.
title: Apollos

description: Qualifications, credentials, and function of apostles.
title: Apostleship

description: The apostolic period extends from the Day of Pentecost to the death of St. John, and covers about seventy years, from AD 30 to 100.
title: Apostolic Age, The

description: The beginnings of the Church in the times of the Apostles.
title: Apostolic Church, The

description: at least a partial listing, including brief biographies of the successors to the Apostles.
title: Apostolic Fathers, The

description: Two friends of Paul whom he met in Corinth, who traveled to Ephesus with him, and were instructors of Apollos.
title: Aquila and Priscilla

description: Aramaic is a language or group of languages of the Semitic family, closely related to Hebrew. Biblical Aramaic, formerly called Chaldee, is the name given to the Aramaic occasionally found in the Old Testament.
title: The Aramaic Language

description: The Areopagus is a hill northwest of the Acropolis in Athens, Greece, where the apostle Paul preached to the intellectuals.
title: Areopagus

description: The Ark of the Tabernacle, its history and typology.
title: Ark of the Covenant

description: a review of the final battle.
title: Armageddon

description: An exposition of Eph. 6:10-17; a discussion of demon organization and tactics; history of Roman armor to explain vocabulary.
title: Armor of God

description: "If training in arms ceases, there is no difference between a soldier and a civilian! and No matter how many years he has served, an unexercised solder is a raw recruit!" - Vegetius
title: Armor of God, Using

description: Scripture passages related to the ascension of the Lord Jesus Christ.
title: Ascension of Christ

description: The land to which this name has been applied plays an important part in some periods of Bible history, and a central part in the history of the earliest Christian mission.
title: Asia Minor

description: Capsule history of the Assyrian Empire.
title: Assyria

description: a thoroughly researched study by George Rawlinson, from The Seven Great Monarchies of the Ancient Eastern World.
title: Assyria (Rawlinson)

description: one of the greatest cultural centers of Paul’s day, grew up around a 520-foot-high rocky plateau called the Acropolis.
title: Athens

description: The Day of Atonement was the fourth of the five annual feasts of pre-exile Israel.
title: Atonement, The Day of

description: a brief biography of the Roman Emperor who sent out the decree at the time of Jesus' birth that "all the world" should be taxed.
title: Augustus

description: Authority of God as delegated to the apostles, and from the apostles to us via the Scriptures; proper responses to civil, ecclesiastical, and family authority.
title: Authority, God's Chain of Command

description: The supreme fertility-god of the Canaanites.
title: Baal

description: The popular designation of the tower (Heb mig?d?l) described in Gen. 11, which people migrating from the East built in the midst of their city in the plain of Shinar.
title: Babel, Tower of

description: Babylon lay on the bank of the Euphrates in the land of Shinar (Gen. 10:10), in the northern area of Babylonia (now southern Iraq) called Accad (as opposed to the southern area called Sumer).

description: detailed ancient history of the Babylonian empire, by George Rawlinson, MA.
title: Babylonia

description: Short description of Balaam's career with reference to the Doctrine of Balaam
title: Balaam

description: The seven types of baptism in the Bible; the baptism of the Holy Spirit; believer's baptism.

description: The Acts of the Apostles describes Barnabas as 'a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith' (Acts 6:24).

description: The eight blessings in the Beatitudes, related to the Christian life.

description: The name of this venerable town means literally "the well of seven." {MAR 2013]

description: The youngest of Jacob's sons, the only one to be born in Palestine; and the tribe named for him. The tribe of the Apostle Paul.

description: When they were driven out of Thessalonica, Paul and Silas came to Berea, where they preached in the synagogue of the Jews.

description: the sister of Herod Agrippa II; features in trial of Paul in Acts 25.

description: The home of Ruth and Boaz, the city of David, the birthplace of Jesus Christ.

description: a Bible teacher's study notes must be converted into exposition which can be understood by his audience.
title: Bible Exegesis and Exposition

description: by Drue Freeman. How to study the Bible with understanding.
title: Bible Study

description: Bithynia was a Roman province in the northwest corner of Asia Minor. 1 Peter 1:1.

description: Bitterness is one of the most crushing mental problems in a person's life; the Bible has solutions.

description: the life of the great Christian author of Pilgrim's Progress.

description: A busybody is a person who inserts himself uninvited into some else’s life, who meddles or pries into the affairs of others. The Bible is very clear that this is wrong, totally inappropriate behavior, especially in a local church congregation.

description: Canaan is an ancient name for the area that includes all of the land west of the Jordan and Syria to the level of Lebweh.
title: Canaan

description: The most important city on the northern shore of the Sea of Galilee. It was here that Jesus established His headquarters for the major part of His public ministry (Mt. 4:13).

description: Caesarea, the Roman capital of Judea in the time of Christ and Paul, was located by the sea, thirty-two miles north of Joppa, and some sixty miles northwest of Jerusalem.

description: Caesarea Philippi was located at the foot of Mt. Hermon ... one of the most beautiful localities in all the Holy Land.

description: A description of the battle for this ancient capital of the Hittite empire, with Bible references
title: Carchemish, Battle of

description: the history of the ancient kingdom where Abraham was born and which later was the locale of the Babylonian empire.

description: mentioned on Paul’s third missionary journey. Chios was especially noted in antiquity for its claim to be the birthplace of Homer, for its school of epic poets, and its sculptors.

description: Properly Cyrus II, the Great, founder of the Persian empire. He reigned from 559 to 530 B.C., and his empire flourished until its conquest by Alexander the Great (331 B.C.).

description: This is a daily Bible reading listing for the year 2012. With this arrangement, you read the whole Bible in a year, but in the chronological order of events. So, for example, many of the Psalms are included with the readings for historical books, because they were written at the time of those events. Likewise, the writings of prophets are included with contemporary historical events.
title: Daily Bible Reading

description: The classic definition comes from R.B. Thieme, Jr.: “The decree of God is His eternal (always existed), holy (perfect integrity), wise (the application of omniscience to creation), and sovereign purpose, comprehending simultaneously all things that ever were or will be in their causes, conditions (status), successions (interaction with others that leads to certain decisions), relations, and determining their certain futurition.”

description: In its most limited sense, "Torah" refers to the Five Books of Moses: Genesis, Exodus, Leviticus, Numbers and Deuteronomy. But the word "torah" can also be used to refer to the entire Jewish bible (the body of scripture known to non-Jews as the Old Testament and to Jews as the Tanakh or Written Torah), or in its broadest sense, to the whole body of Jewish law and teachings.
title: Torah, Jewish Teachings on

title: Traditionalism

description: The doctrine of the trinity recognizes God as being one in essence but three persons who possess equal, perfect, eternal and infinite identical essence.
title: Trinity

description: On the second missionary journey, Paul and Silas came to Troas after being forbidden to preach the Word of God in Asia (Acts 16:6).
